title: Most Exciting Destinations To Visit In Scotland (Seenu Mathew)
text: By Seenu Mathew Oct 22, 2015 Scotland, in the UK, is a fascinating place to visit. Steeped in history and culture, the country attracts tourists from all over the world. Exploring the different destinations in Scotland makes for a wonderful travel experience. From visits to nature parks to whiskey tours and sightseeing to art festivals, the country is a treasure trove of options that is suited to many different kinds of travellers. Read on to know about the most exciting destinations to visit in Scotland:Edinburgh:This is the capital city of Scotland and one of the most popular places to visit in the country. Edinburgh is famous for its historical heritage. The Edinburgh Castle, the most prominent attraction in the city, will fascinate you with its wonderful architecture and imposing stance. The best way to go sightseeing in the city is to take a tour on an open-top bus. Apart from the castle, you'll also be able to see the Royal Mile that joins the castle to the Holyrood House Palace. Other points of interest include Greyfriars Bobby, the Parliament Building and the Scott Museum.Trossachs National Park:The Trossachs National Park was the first national park established by the country. Trossachs National Park is home to many hill ranges and lakes, the most famous of them being the Trossachs range of hills and Loch Lomond. You can explore the beautiful national park through walking tours. The most popular walking tour is through the Loch Lomond area of the park and is often included in many Scotland holiday packages. Make it a point to go to the visitor's centre called Loch Lomond Shores, located at the southern edge of the lake. You can opt for a cruise on the lake, which makes for a relaxing and enjoyable experience.Glasgow:Glasgow is another favourite tourist destination in Scotland. The city is known for its beautiful examples of architecture, ranging from the Victorian to art nouveau styles. Glasgow is also quite famous for being a cultural centre and many artistic institutions flourish here. A tour of the many important sites and museums is a great way to explore the city. Glasgow is home to the Scottish Opera, Scottish Ballet and National Theatre of Scotland. Several Scotland holiday packages even provide passes to top-rated performances and shows in Glasgow. It's a great way to truly get an insight into the art of not just the city, but Scotland as a whole. About the Author Seenu Mathew is a Web UI Designer / Developer with Cox & Kings. Travelling and photography are his passions. He recently returned from one of the Scotland holiday packages . In this article, he lists the most exciting destinations in the country and the many sites and experiences one can enjoy is each place. Rating:
